name: Harker School
description: The Harker School is a private, coeducational, nonsectarian school in San Jose, CA, offering education from preschool through grade 12.
note: 2025 entry: Children born 2019-07-01 to 2020-06-30 must apply for K; 2020-07-01 to 2020-11-30 can apply for TK or K (not both).

name: BASIS Independent Silicon Valley
description: BASIS Independent Silicon Valley is a private school in Sunnyvale, CA, offering a rigorous curriculum from transitional kindergarten through grade 12.
note: TK: must be 4 by May 31. K: must be 5 by Sep 1.

name: St. Andrew’s Episcopal School
description: St. Andrew’s Episcopal School is a private, coeducational school in Saratoga, CA, serving students from preschool through grade 8.

name: Phillips Brooks School
description: Phillips Brooks School is a private, coeducational day school in Menlo Park, CA, serving students from preschool through grade 5.

name: Synapse School
description: Synapse School is a private, coeducational school in Menlo Park, CA, offering a project-based curriculum from transitional kindergarten through grade 8.

name: The Nueva School
description: The Nueva School is a private, coeducational school in Hillsborough, CA, serving gifted students from pre-kindergarten through grade 12.
note: 2025 entry: PreK Round1: must turn 4 by Mar 9; PreK Round2: must turn 4 by May 26. PreK after May 27 ineligible. K must be 5 by Sep 1.

name: Stratford School
description: Stratford School is a private, coeducational school with multiple campuses in the Bay Area, offering programs from preschool through grade 8.
address: 6670 San Anselmo Way, San Jose, CA 95119
note: Preschool: 2.5+ years old and toilet-trained. PreK/K: must be 4/5 by Dec 2. TK: age 5 between Sep 2–Feb 2.

name: Trinity School
description: Trinity School is a private, coeducational school in Menlo Park, CA, serving students from preschool through grade 5.
address: 2650 Sand Hill Rd, Menlo Park, CA 94025

name: Monticello Academy
description: Monticello Academy is a private, coeducational school in Santa Clara, CA, offering programs from preschool through grade 8.

name: The Carey School
description: The Carey School is a private, coeducational school in San Mateo, CA, serving students from preschool through grade 5.
address: One Carey School Lane, San Mateo, CA 94403

name: Tessellations School
description: Tessellations School is a private, coeducational school in Cupertino, CA, offering a project-based curriculum for gifted students from preschool through grade 8.

name: Sacred Heart Schools, Atherton
description: Sacred Heart Schools, Atherton is a private, Roman Catholic, coeducational school in Atherton, CA, serving students from preschool through grade 12.

name: Serendipity School
description: Serendipity School is a private, coeducational school in Belmont, CA, offering programs from preschool through grade 5.

name: Challenger School
description: Challenger School is a private, coeducational school with multiple campuses in the Bay Area, offering programs from preschool through grade 8.
address: 711 East Gish Rd, San Jose, CA 95112
note: Children are eligible for preschool at 2y9m. K applicants must be 5 by December 2 (California rule).

name: Keys School
description: Keys School is a private, coeducational school in Palo Alto, CA, serving students from kindergarten through grade 8.

name: Helios School
description: Helios School is a private K–8 school in Sunnyvale, CA, designed specifically for gifted learners. It offers project-based, expeditionary learning with a strong emphasis on outdoor education and social-emotional development.

name: Pinewood School
description: Pinewood School is a private, non-sectarian college preparatory school in Los Altos, CA, serving students from kindergarten through grade 12. It is known for its strong programs in performing arts and mathematics.

name: Valley Christian Schools
description: Valley Christian Schools is a private, non-denominational Christian school in San Jose, CA, offering a K–12 college preparatory education. It emphasizes academic excellence, Christian values, and leadership development.
note: K applicants must be 5 years old on or before October 1 of the enrollment year.
